intro: Erythrochiton carinatus, commonly known as the scarlet hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers, which are typically borne on long, slender stems. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its colorful blooms. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Erythrochiton carinatus is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton.
